results.title: Three "I"s: a trio of personal films about Sweden by two Canadians and one Swede
results.creator_credit: Martin Duckworth, Mort Ransen, Eric M Nilsson, John Kemeny, Wolf Koenig, Joseph Koenig, Swedish Institute for Cultural Relations and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A film trilogy presenting impressions of Sweden by two Canadians and one Swede: Mort Ransen and Martin Duckworth of the National Film Board, and Swedish director Eric M. Nilsson. The film is composed of three films: “A Place for everything” - Eric Nilsson takes up the contrasts in the well-ordered Swedish society - order versus spontaneity; individual desires set against collective needs; subordinares vis-a-vis superiors. The young Swedes interviewed make a plea for independence, imagination and the discussion of existing conditions. “Falling from ladders” - Simply by putting about 20 Swedish men, women and young people in front of his camera and having them read aloud from the Statistical Year Book, filmmaker Mort Ransen has recorded a wide range of impressions of Sweden’s economic and social existence. Quotations vary from the whole gamut of exports and imports, marriages formed or dissolved, to the number of people who fall from ladders annually. (Award: Philadelphia) “Passing through Sweden” - A film critic of one of Sweden’s daily newspapers says of this film by Martin Duckworth, “Never before have I seen a film that so intensely interpreted the experience of Swedish surroundings…an ‘atmospheric film’ in which all the expression is in the pictures.”
results.title_for_label: Three “I”s: a trio of personal films about Sweden by two Canadians and one Swede
results.creator_credit_for_label: Martin Duckworth, Mort Ransen, Eric M Nilsson, John Kemeny, Wolf Koenig, Joseph Koenig, Swedish Institute for Cultural Relations and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: The Butler
results.creator_credit: Anna Kannava, John Cruthers and Huzzah Productions
results.brief_description: An intimate portrait of a Greek family and their experience of migration and integration into Australian life. Nino, the youngest, is the vehicle used to explore the alienation and shock that are part of migration, the complexity of family relationships and the integration of the intellectually disabled into the community. “The Butler” is the sequel to “Ten years after, ten years older” also held in the collection.

results.title: Woodstock: 3 days of peace & music (S) (Director's cut) [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Michael Wadleigh, Bob Maurice and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Winner of the Best Documentary Feature at the 1970 Academy Awards, director Michael Wadleigh’s film captures the spirit of Woodstock- three days of peace and music. Included on the tape are performances from the following artists: Crosby, Stills and Nash, Canned Heat, Richie Havens, Joan Baez, The Who, Sha-Na-Na, Joe Cocker and the Grease Band, Country Joe and the Fish, Arlo Guthrie, Ten Years After, Jefferson Airplane, John Sebastian, Country Joe McDonald, Santana, Sly and the Family Stone, Janis Joplin and Jimi Hendrix.

results.title: Stiletto [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Louise Leroux, Eric Michel and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: ‘Stiletto’ is an intriguing investigation of society’s fascination with fetishistic footwear. The impact of the stiletto heel on both fashion and culture is scrutinised from a number of perspectives by people including an historian, a podiatrist, a fashion therapist, a fashion designer, and the manufacturers of fetishistic shoes. Looks at stilettos in relation to roleplay, festishism, gender roles, foot- binding, and images of sexuality, using archival footage and photo- graphic stills as supporting evidence.

results.title: 25 years of International Air Tattoo
results.brief_description: In 1996 the International Air Tattoo celebrated its Silver Jubilee. From humble beginnings, as a small airshow at North Weald airfield in 1971, the Tattoo progressed to become an annual event of international stature, staged to support the ongoing work of the Royal Air Force Benevolent Fund. Today, the International Air Tattoo is the biggest multinational gathering of military aircraft in the world. Using recent and archival footage, this tape captures the achievements and history of a movement that has sparked international attention and involvement. Written and narrated by Sean Maffett.

results.title: Land of the borders
results.creator_credit: Simon Crouch and Border Television PLC
results.brief_description: This tape comprises of two parts; the Battlegrounds, and Eastern Borders, as Melvyn Bragg explores the wild and empty landscapes sprinkled with castles, fortresses and abbeys that provide the backdrop to Europe’s turbulent history. In the Battleground section, Bragg traces the forces and events that shaped the lives of those from the Western Borders. He visits Hadrian’s Wall, Carlisle Castle, Lanercost Priory, Caerlaverock Castle, Burgh by Sands, the Lochmabonstane truce site, Hermitage Castle, plus many other key locations. In the Eastern Borders section Bragg considers the influence of religion and the sea. Beginning with the founding of the monastery on Holy Island, the sea meanwhile provided people with a living as well as a source of disaster and heroism. Places visited include The Holy Island, Norham Castle, Melrose Abbey, the River Tweed, the Yetholm Show, battleground and memorial at Flodden, Alnwick Castle, plus many other sites from the region.

results.title: Waco: the rules of engagement
results.creator_credit: William Gazecki, Michael McNulty, Dan Gifford and Fifth Estate Productions
results.brief_description: This film presents amazing revelations about what really went on at Waco, Texas in 1993 when 76 men, women and children and 4 federal agents died in the siege of the compound of David Koresh’ religious sect. Through a collation of news footage, coverage of the Senate hearings after the tragedy, tapes of 911 phone calls, and interviews with experts and survivors, we are given a very different picture to that which the United States Senate would have us believe. There is no narrator in this documentary, rather Gazecki presents the evidence through the words of the experts, those who were on the scene of the tragedy and who knew the sect members. In this film you will see what the media did not show us, and it is an enlightening view of how marginal groups are treated in our democratic society.
results.creator_credit_for_label: William Gazecki, Michael McNulty, Dan Gifford and Fifth Estate Productions

results.title: Kurt & Courtney
results.brief_description: Nick Broomfield’s controversial documentary “Kurt & Courtney” looks at the volatile relationship between Nirvana rock legend Kurt Cobain and Courtney Love, whose career as lead singer of Hole and as an actress took off not long after Cobain’s death. As well as attempting to delve into the psyches of Cobain and Love (aka Frances Farmer), Broomfield looks at the various theories surrounding Cobain’s death, which was shrouded in mystery and which instantly became part of the long list of conspiracy theories which our society finds so compelling. Broomfield’s documentary is in no way objective, but it is fascinating to watch, as the director pointedly incorporates his own battle to get his film made with Courtney Love vehemently attempting to stop the film. With home footage of Cobain and interviews with people who knew Cobain and Love, this is a must see for Nirvana fans (although due to legal constraints Broomfield could not use any music by Nirvana in the film). Curiously Kurt remains a shadowy figure in the film, and you actually get a stronger sense of Courtney Love as well as the various ‘hangers on’ who Broomfield interviews throughout the film.

results.title: PANACEA: the documentary
results.creator_credit: Ioannis Ioannou, Cinemedia, Rose Myers, Vanessa Rouse and Arena Theatre Company
results.brief_description: ‘PANACEA the documentary’ follows the journey of Arena Theatre Company’s creative team as they embark on an ambitious large scale performance event fusing modern technology and cinematic devices. A combination of conventional theatre and MTV culture.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ioannis Ioannou, Cinemedia, Rose Myers, Vanessa Rouse and Arena Theatre Company
